Method Detail

getPreference

public static java.lang.String getPreference(java.lang.String preferenceName,
                                             java.lang.String userGuid,
                                             java.lang.String userName)
API that allows you to fetch the preference for a given user. If LDAP is in the techstack, it will check LDAP first and if the preference is not available, will then check the correpsonding profile. Preferences supported:
  • ApplSession.LANGUAGE
  • ApplSession.TERRITORY
  • ApplSession.TIMEZONE
  • ApplSession.NUMBER_FORMAT
  • ApplSession.DATE_FORMAT
  • ApplSession.TIME_FORMAT
  • ApplSession.ACCESSIBILITY_MODE
  • ApplSession.CHARACTER_ENCODING
  • ApplSession.CLIENT_ENCODING
  • ApplSession.COLOR_CONTRAST
  • ApplSession.CURRENCY
  • ApplSession.EMBEDDED_HELP
  • ApplSession.FONT_SIZE

    Parameters:
    preferenceName - the name of the preference to fetch
    userGuid - the GUID of the user whose preference is being fetched. Either the name or the GUID should be passed, if both then the userGuide takes precedence.
    userName - the name of the user whose preference is being fetched
    Returns:
    the preference value

    • getPreferences

    public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getPreferences(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> preferenceNames,
                                                                                  java.lang.String userGuid,
                                                                                  java.lang.String userName)
    This is a batch version of the getPreference api that allows you to select multiple preferences at once, which should be faster.

    Parameters:
    preferenceNames - a Set of preference names to fetch
    userGuid - the GUID of the user whose preference is being fetched. Either the name or the GUID should be passed, if both then the userGuide takes precedence.
    userName - the name of the user whose preference is being fetched
    Returns:
    a HashMap of name value pairs representing the preference values
    See Also:
    for the list of support attributes.
